ygData.subject: Re: Interesting tactic to damage monsters...
ygData.msgSnippet: I would believe you have to do at least half the damage to the MOB before you can get the XP for it.  Seems logical that this would have to happen. - Ziffnab,
ygData.messageBody:
I would believe you have to do at least half the damage to the MOB before
you can get the XP for it. Seems logical that this would have to happen.

- Ziffnab, Xegony

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Windows/BrownG/bryson On Behalf Of Valacian
> Sent: Monday, May 10, 1999 2:26 PM
> To: 'eq_wizards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eq_wizards] Interesting tactic to damage monsters...
>
> This is a nifty idea. Are you getting the experience for it? I've seen
> NPC's fall from high places and die before and have never been able to get
> any experience for it.
>
>
> Valacian - 21st Level Erudite Wizard, Xegony
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Paul McClung [SMTP:p.e.mcclung@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 10, 1999 8:18 AM
> To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eq_wizards] Interesting tactic to damage
> monsters...
>
> From: Paul McClung <p.e.mcclung@...>
>
> This weekend I was experimenting with an interesting new tactic to
> cause
> damage to monsters. The problem was that I really couldn't verify
> how well
> it works, because I'm not certain if monsters take damage from
> falling or not.
>
>
> But what I would do is hit a monster from long distance with a
> spell, then
> run up a VERY VERY steep cliff. Once at the top of the cliff I wait
> till
> the monster hits me, then I hit the fade button. 9 times out of 10,
> fade
> takes me to the bottom of the cliff. The monster then jumps off the
> cliff
> to get me, and I'm assuming it takes some damage from the fall.
>
>
> I did this a couple times... the biggest problem is finding suitable
> cliffs
> to fade from, and the second worst problem is being careful not to
> fall in
> myself.
>
>
> Flik
>
>
>
>
